# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 5GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session

import pandas as pd
dfw = pd.read_csv('../input/solar-power-generation-data/Plant_1_Weather_Sensor_Data.csv')
dfp = pd.read_csv('../input/solar-power-generation-data/Plant_1_Generation_Data.csv')

source.827e5c12:
dfw['DATE_TIME'] = pd.to_datetime(dfw['DATE_TIME'],format = '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M')
# Converting Datetime COlumn from object to datetime format
dfw['DATE'] = pd.to_datetime(dfw['DATE_TIME'],format = '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M').dt.date
# Splitting DateTime into Date
dfw['DATE'] = pd.to_datetime(dfw['DATE'])

source.e7eac86a:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.figure(figsize=(18,9)) # To increase the size of the graph
plt.plot(dfp['DATE_TIME'],dfp['AC_POWER'].rolling(window=20).mean(),label = 'AC POWER')
plt.title('AC Power vs Date and Time for 34 days ')
plt.xlabel('DATE AND TIME')
plt.ylabel('AC POWER')
plt.legend()
plt.grid()
plt.margins(0.05)
plt.show()

source.fc9118d2:
#Plotting the Scatter Chart for Daily Yield vs Date and time and categorising by Date for 34 days 
dates = dfp['DATE'].unique()
plt.figure(figsize=(18,9))



for date in dates:
    df_data = dfp[dfp['DATE']==date]

    plt.plot(df_data.DATE_TIME,
            df_data.DAILY_YIELD,#.rolling(window=20).mean(),
            marker='o',
            linestyle='',
            alpha=.5,
            ms=10,
            label=pd.to_datetime(date,format='%Y-%m-%d').date()
           )

plt.grid()
plt.margins(0.05)
plt.legend()
plt.title('Daily Yield vs Date and Time for 34 days Scatter sorted by date')
plt.xlabel('Date and Time')
plt.ylabel('Daily Yield')
plt.show()
source.3b3085cb:
plt.figure(figsize=(18,9)) # To increase the size of the graph

plt.plot(dfw.DATE_TIME,
        dfw.AMBIENT_TEMPERATURE.rolling(window=20).mean(),
        label='Ambient'
       )

plt.plot(dfw.DATE_TIME,
        dfw.MODULE_TEMPERATURE.rolling(window=20).mean(),color='r',
        label='Module'
       )

plt.plot(dfw.DATE_TIME,
        (dfw.MODULE_TEMPERATURE-dfw.AMBIENT_TEMPERATURE).rolling(window=20).mean(),color='g',
        label='Difference'
       )

plt.grid()
plt.margins(0.05)
plt.legend()
plt.title('Ambient Tempreture and Module Tempreture over 34 Days')
plt.xlabel('Date and Time')
plt.ylabel('Tempreture')
plt.grid()
plt.show()
source.4ed54d38:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.figure(figsize=(18,8))
plt.plot(dfw['DATE_TIME'],dfw['AMBIENT_TEMPERATURE'].rolling(window=20).mean(),label ='AMBIENT',c='r')
plt.plot(dfw['DATE_TIME'],dfw['MODULE_TEMPERATURE'].rolling(window=20).mean(),label ='MODULE',c='orange')
plt.plot(dfw['DATE_TIME'],dfw['MODULE_TEMPERATURE']-dfw['AMBIENT_TEMPERATURE'].rolling(window=20).mean(),label ='DIFFERENCE',c='k')
plt.grid()
plt.xlabel('Date and Time')
plt.ylabel('Tempreture')
plt.margins(0.05)
plt.legend()
plt.show()

dates = dfw['DATE'].unique()
plt.figure(figsize=(18,8))


for date in dates:
    df_data = dfw[dfw['DATE']==date]#[df_Plant1wsd['IRRADIATION']>0]

    plt.plot(df_data.AMBIENT_TEMPERATURE,
            df_data.MODULE_TEMPERATURE,
            marker='o',
            linestyle='',
            alpha=.5,
            ms=10,
            label=pd.to_datetime(date,format='%Y-%m-%d').date()
           )

plt.margins(0.05)
plt.legend()
plt.title('Scatter Plot sorted by date showing How Module Temperature varies with Ambient Temperature for 34 Days')

plt.ylabel('Module Temperature')
plt.show()

source.d539d601:
plt.figure(figsize=(18,8))


date = dates[4]
inverters = result_left2['SOURCE_KEY_x'].unique()

for inverter in inverters:

    data = result_left2[(result_left2['DATE_x']==date)&(result_left2['SOURCE_KEY_x']==inverter)&(result_left2['IRRADIATION']>0.1)]

    plt.plot(data.MODULE_TEMPERATURE,
                data.DC_POWER,
                marker='o',
                linestyle='',
                alpha=.5,
                ms=10,
                label=inverter
               )
plt.grid()
plt.margins(0.05)
plt.legend()
plt.title('DC Power vs. Module Tempreture')
plt.xlabel('Module Tempreture')
plt.ylabel('DC Power')
plt.show()
